en_doc: Packaging of DUAL PURPOSE paper has two purposes; it is designed entirely as any other packaging of this product, except that closing is similar to drawstring trash bag closing. As a result of this simple intervention in packaging turned it in a product with a mission. We hope that this example will encourage other manufacturers to start thinking about the impact of their packaging waste on the environment, and customers to think about the use of each packaging waste as means of waste disposal agent. Let's move on! Packaging material for our new paper towel contains 92% less plastic. Let's treat nature with respect as it deserves and be a part for sustainable change. Toilet paper can „save your life“! Prevention and early detection of colorectal cancer are important, so we have created a „bold product“ that reminds consumers to self-test on colorectal cancer and take care of their own health. Finding the right and the best cleaning products for the job is the hardest part of cleaning! The best products for floor cleaning, kitchen, bathroom and more are on offer in the Violeta and Teta Violeta assortiment. Let's head for a cleaner, tidier, clutter free home with the Teta Violeta support. Let's reduce waste! New „DUAL PURPOSE“ toilet paper made with 100% recycled paper, in 100% recycled packaging. New „DUAL PURPOSE“ toilet paper made with 100% recycled paper, in 100% recycled packaging. Packed in nothing less than a usable waste bag.
sl_doc: Embalaža dvonamenskega toaletnega papirja DUAL PURPOSE je v osnovi zasnovana kot običajne embalaže toaletnega papirja, le da ima integriran zatezni trak, ki smo ga vajeni iz vrečk za smeti. Zahvaljujoč temu majhnemu dodatku je naš izdelek presegel svoje običajne meje in postal izdelek s poslanstvom. Upamo, da bo ta primer spodbudil druge proizvajalce, da začnejo razmišljati o vplivu odpadne embalaže na okolje, kupce pa k dojemanju uporabnosti posamezne embalaže kot vrečke za smeti. Gremo naprej! Embalaža novih papirnatih brisač ECO vsebuje 92 % manj plastike. Ravnajmo z naravo s spoštovanjem, ki si ga zasluži, in bodimo del trajnostnih sprememb. Toaletni papir vam lahko »reši življenje«! Preventiva in zgodnje odkrivanje raka debelega črevesa sta ključni komponenti za zdravljenje bolezni. Zato smo ustvarili drzen izdelek, ki potrošnike opozarja na pomembnost samopregledovanja in skrbi za lastno zdravje. SLO Najtežji korak pri čiščenju je najti dobre izdeke, ki opravijo svoje delo! Najboljše najdete v naši ponudbi, v sklopu blagovnih znamk Violeta in Teta Violeta. Vstopimo v čist, urejen dom s pomočjo Tete Violete. Zmanjšajmo količino odpadkov! Novi toaletni papir DUAL PURPOSE je 100 % recikliran, s 100 % reciklirano embalažo. Le ta ima dvojno funcionalnost, saj jo lahko uporabite tudi kot vrečko za smeti.

en_doc: Experience the city of Midgar like never before FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE INTERGRADE comes bundled with FF7R EPISODE INTERmission featuring Yuffie as the main character which introduces an exhilarating new story arc, and numerous gameplay additions for players to enjoy. Key features FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE INTERGRADE includes a wealth of graphical, gameplay and system enhancements: Improved visuals Immerse yourself in the city of Midgar like never before, with improved textures, lighting, and background environments "Performance Mode" prioritizes smooth action at 60 frames per second Extensive Photo Mode Capture and share your memorable moments from the game with a fully customizable “Photo Mode” Players can enjoy immersive battles by using the DualSense wireless controller with its haptic feedback integration The new episode featuring Yuffie is a brand-new adventure in the world of FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE INTERGRADE. Play as Wutai ninja Yuffie Kisaragi as she infiltrates Midgar and conspires with Avalanche HQ to steal the ultimate materia from the Shinra Electric Power Company. Play alongside new characters and enjoy an expanded gameplay experience featuring multiple new combat and gameplay additions. This adventure brings new perspective to the FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE story that cannot be missed. FF7R EPISODE INTERmission is included with FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE INTERGRADE, but is available to owners of the original FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE as a separate purchase below. Buy digital Available from PlayStation Store Standard Edition includes:
sl_doc: Mesto Midgar lahko izkusite kot še nikoli doslej V paketu z igro FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE INTERGRADE je na voljo FF7R EPISODE INTERmission, v katerem vlogo glavnega lika prevzame Yuffie, kar predstavi razburljivo novo poglavje zgodbe in številne dodatke med igranjem, v katerih lahko igralci uživajo. Igra FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE INTERGRADE vključuje bogastvo izboljšav grafične podobe, igranja in sistema: Izboljšana vizualna podoba Potopite se v mesto Midgar kot še nikoli doslej z izboljšanimi teksturami, osvetlitvijo in okolji v ozadju »Performance Mode« daje prednost gladki akciji pri 60 sličicah na sekundo Zajemite in delite nepozabne trenutke iz igre s popolnoma prilagodljivim »Fotografskim načinom« Igralci lahko uživajo v imerzivnih bitkah prek brezžičnega igralnega ploščka DualSense z integriranim čutnim odzivom Nova epizoda z Yuffie v glavni vlogi je povsem nova pustolovščina v svetu igre FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE INTERGRADE. Igrajte kot Wutai nindža Yuffie Kisaragi, ki se vtihotapi v Midgar in z sedežem skupine Avalanche načrtuje krajo ultimativne materie od podjetja Shinra Electric Power Company. Igrajte skupaj z novimi liki in uživajte v razširjeni igralni izkušnji z več novimi bojnimi in igralnimi dodatki. Ta pustolovščina prinaša novo perspektivo na zgodbo v igri FINAL FANTASY VII REMAKE, ki je ne gre zgrešiti. en_doc: Igor Zabel's archive is, after a considerable effort, neatly arranged, listed and available at Ljubljana's Modern Gallery Archives Department. Since 1971, the department collects, processes and keeps materials on exhibitions in Slovenia and exhibitions of Slovenian artists abroad, art exhibition grounds and other spaces of creation and presentation of visual arts, visual artists of Slovenia in the 20th and 21st centuries, Slovenian authors of art theory and criticism of the 20th and 21st centuries. These represent the largest database from the mentioned fields and may be used by the public for scientific and research, cultural, education and journalistic purposes. Soon, we will also publish an updated list of Igor Zabel's projects. Thanks to Simona Žvanut for her meticulous work and to the department's curators for their support!
sl_doc: Popisan in pregledno urejen arhiv Igorja Zabela je odslej na voljo na oddelku Dokumentacija-arhiv Moderne galerije. Slednji od leta 1971 zbira, obdeluje in hrani gradivo ter se ponaša z najobsežnejšo zbirko o razstavah v Sloveniji in razstavah slovenskih umetnikov v tujini, likovnih razstaviščih in drugih prostorih nastajanja in prezentiranja likovne umetnosti, likovnih umetnikih 20. in 21. stoletja na Slovenskem ter slovenskih piscih o likovni umetnosti 20. in 21. stoletja. Kmalu bomo objavili tudi dopolnjen seznam projektov Igorja Zabela. Hvala Simoni Žvanut za skrbnost in natančnost in kustosinjam arhiva za podporo!
comments: lahko bi bil tudi promotion

en_doc: About the Roads to »The Grandest Invention of Human Spirit« in Slovenia: Milestones in the Development of the Drama Society in Ljubljana. About the Roads to »The Grandest Invention of Human Spirit« in Slovenia: Milestones in the Development of the Drama Society in Ljubljana. Čas: 10.00 - 14.00 vsak dan The exhibition on the 150th anniversary of the Drama Society in Ljubljana The Drama Society in Ljubljana (founded in 1867) was the initiator of the Slovenian theatre of modern age – the foundation of the Society was the beginning of the institution and professionalization of Slovenian theatre. The exhibition on the 150th anniversary of the Drama Society in Ljubljana The Drama Society in Ljubljana (founded in 1867) was the initiator of the Slovenian theatre of modern age – the foundation of the Society was the beginning of the institution and professionalization of Slovenian theatre. In its development from 1867 to 1920 it negotiated a fifty-year long road through the period of institutionalisation and professionalization of the Slovenian theatre, finishing it in 1920 with the advent of a new development stage; i.e., Europeanisation (1920–1945). The exhibition is focused on the first fifty years of the Drama Society’s activity, shedding light on the important and decisive milestones of its development. The exhibition is focused on the first fifty years of the Drama Society’s activity, shedding light on the important and decisive milestones of its development. A great example was set by Anton Tomaž Linhart as the pioneer of the Slovenian theatre of modern era and the early predecessor of the Drama Society. A great example was set by Anton Tomaž Linhart as the pioneer of the Slovenian theatre of modern era and the early predecessor of the Drama Society. All these elements, together with general theatrical examples, the influences of time (observed in larger nations) and the Spring of Nations (1848) fostered among Slovenes the awareness of the necessity of having a national theatre. The exhibition provides evidence and arguments for twelve significant progressive phenomena in the development of the Drama Society – from the rudimentary origins of the Society during Metternich and Bach absolutism (1848 to 1851) to the formation of the Slovenian theatre as a public institution and the beginning of its Europeanisation (1920). The illustration material includes manuscripts, portraits of meritorious originators of the Drama Society and the theatre people of the time, theatre reviews, posters and flyers, old photographs and postcards, relevant books of that time, models of two most important theatres, etc.
sl_doc: ODPRTJE RAZSTAVE O poteh k »najlepši iznajdbi človeškega duha« na Slovenskem: Mejniki v razvoju Dramatičnega društva v Ljubljani Razstava, ki jo v SLOGI – Gledališkem muzeju pripravljamo ob 150-letnici ustanovitve Dramatičnega društva v Ljubljani, se osredotoča na prvih petdeset let delovanja Društva, pri čemer skuša osvetliti pomembne in odločilne mejnike na njegovi razvojni poti. Dramatično društvo v Ljubljani (ustanovljeno l. 1867) je začetnik slovenskega gledališča moderne dobe. V svojem razvoju od leta 1867 do 1920 prehodi petdesetletno pot skozi dobo institucionalizacije in profesionalizacije slovenskega gledališča in jo sklene v letu 1920, ko nastopi nova razvojna stopnja, doba evropeizacije (1920‒1945). Dramatično društvo v Ljubljani (ustanovljeno l. 1867) je začetnik slovenskega gledališča moderne dobe. ODPRTJE RAZSTAVE O poteh k »najlepši iznajdbi človeškega duha« na Slovenskem: Mejniki v razvoju Dramatičnega društva v Ljubljani

en_doc: Solution for a realistic business plan The SAP Analytics Cloud tool that you receive from us is intended for companies where plans and projections are not merely a formality. Whether you need assistance with annual financial plans, sales plans, the planning of labour costs or a plan for a specific operation, our online service will help you create the most realistic forecast possible. The system itself will ensure the merging of the plans of individual departments or teams at your company. Your path to the finished product is simpler as you have the best possible pre-prepared methodology for the drafting of plans and the simulation of various plan versions. The accuracy and reality of the plan are ensured through artificial intelligence, which monitors the consistency of your data and the correlation between different data. Analyses and reports are a key element of business plan monitoring. Users of the SAP Analytics Cloud can avoid complex report drafting procedures and obsolete investments in the development of your own OLAP cube. Smart insights and Smart discovery functions allow you to logically link and analyse the data and differences between the planned and actual figures. Random reports are compiled by you alone in a few seconds, with a simple selection of parameters that you wish to include in your analysis. Artificial intelligence draws your attention to the trends that you would otherwise miss when using conventional reports. Solution for business forecasts and for the monitoring of realisation Use a professional tool for business planning and realisation You can begin to use our solution in the shortest possible time, as it runs in a secure computer cloud. You only need a computer or smart phone for access. From now on the drafting of annual plans will be simpler, the figures more realistic and thus less errors will be made. You simply generate, monitor and adjust plans and short-term forecasts, including the realisation and the reservation of funds, in one place. The drafting of individual reports is simpler than ever before. Business planning and monitoring realisation in the cloud Reliable contemporary online service for small, medium-sized and large enterprises. A simple and intelligent service that you can start using immediately Our online service for business planning, reservation of funds and the monitoring of realisation is set up in a secure SAP cloud. You can use it immediately without the strenuous and expensive projects aimed at setting-up the system. It supports planning such that it includes all stakeholders, the simulation of different scenarios, the automated generation of reports and a number of useful artificial intelligence functions. Smart business projections
sl_doc: Rešitev za realen poslovni načrt Orodje SAP Analytics Cloud, ki ga dobite pri nas, je namenjeno podjetjem, kjer plan in projekcija nista le formalnost. Naj gre za letni finančni načrt, prodajni načrt, načrtovanje stroškov dela ali plan posamične operacije, vam bo naša spletna storitev nudila pomoč pri izdelavi čim bolj realne napovedi. Za združevanje planov posamičnih oddelkov ali skupin v vašem podjetju bo poskrbel sistem sam. Pot do končnega izdelka je enostavnejša, ker imate na voljo najboljšo možno pred-pripravljeno metodologijo izdelave plana in simulacije različnih variant načrta. Natančnost in realnost plana zagotavlja umetna inteligenca, ki spremlja konsistentnost vaših podatkov in korelacije med njimi. Analize in poročila so ključen element nadzora poslovnega plana. Uporabniki SAP Analytics Cloud lahko pozabite na zahtevne postopke izdelave poročila in zastarele investicije v razvoj vaše lastne OLAP kocke. Funkcije Smart insights in Smart discovery vam same pomagajo smiselno povezati ter analizirati podatke in razlike med planom in realizacijo. Poljubno poročilo sestavite sami v nekaj sekundah, s preprosto izbiro parametrov, ki jih želite vključiti v vašo analizo. Umetna inteligenca vas opozori na trende, ki bi z uporabo klasičnih poročil ostali očem skriti. Rešitev za poslovne napovedi in spremljanje realizacije Uporabite profesionalno orodje za poslovno planiranje in realizacijo Našo rešitev lahko pričnete uporabljati v najkrajšem možnem času, saj deluje v varnem računalniškem oblaku. Za dostop potrebujete le računalnik ali pametni telefon. Izdelava letnih planov bo odslej bolj enostavna, številke bodo bolj realne in manj bo napak. Na enem mestu enostavno ustvarite, spremljate in prilagajate plane in kratkoročne napovedi, realizacijo in rezervacije sredstev. Izdelava posamičnih poročil je enostavnejša kot kadarkoli prej. Poslovno planiranje in spremljanje realizacije v oblaku Zanesljiva sodobna spletna storitev za mala, srednja in velika podjetja. Enostavna in inteligentna storitev, ki jo lahko začnete uporabljati takoj Naša spletna storitev za načrtovanje poslovanja, rezervacije sredstev in spremljanje realizacije je postavljena v varnem SAP oblaku. Uporabite jo lahko takoj, brez napornih in dragih projektov za vzpostavitev sistema. Podpira planiranje na način, ki vključuje vse deležnike, simulacije različnih scenarijev, avtomatsko generiranje poročil in številne koristne funkcije umetne inteligence. Pametne poslovne projekcije

en_doc: The version is improved with new functions, that make migrations of existing systems (NetApp, as well as rival systems) easier, with the help of Scale-Out solution technology Clustered ONTAP. CBT (Copy-Based Transition), CFT (Copy-Free Transition) and FLI (Foreign LUN import) are all processes that lead to the same result – migrating data on the Scale-out platform, which enables easier updates and expandability. Every step was carefully explained and debated about with all of the attendees. Thus many participants saw added value in this process and were eager to try it out for themselves in their business environments. Arnold Schwarzenegger once said: » Power doesn't come from winning, it develops with training. Only when you overcome strains and don't give up – then you really improve. « The bowling competition was really good and even reached some top-leaderboard points that would have been even a serious threat to professional bowlers.
sl_doc: Verzijo izpopolnjujejo nove funkcionalnosti, ki lajšajo prehode iz obstoječih sistemov (tako NetApp kot tudi konkurenčnih) na tehnologijo Scale-Out rešitve Clustered ONTAP. CBT (Copy-Based Transition), CFT (Copy-Free Transition) in FLI (Foreign LUN import) so postopki, ki pripeljejo do istega cilja – preseljene podatke na Scale-out platformo, ki zagotavlja enostavno nadgradljivost in razširljivost. Vsak korak smo pokomentirali in ga skupaj predebatirali. Marsikdo izmed udeležencev je v tehnologiji videl dodano vrednost, ki jo bo v svojem okolju zagotovo preskusil. Nekoč je zapisal Arnold Schwarzenegger: »Moč ne pride z zmago, gradijo jo treningi. Šele ko premaguješ napore in se ne predaš – takrat napreduješ.« Bitka s podiranjem kegljev se je stopnjevala do vrhunskih rezultatov, ki bi jih zavidal tudi resnejši bowling rekreativec.

en_doc: Head of the Section for the History of the Slovenian Language, senior research fellow, assistant professor, researcher in the project of compiling the Dictionary of the 16th-Century Slovenian Literary Language (SSKJ16) Andreja Legan Ravnikar (2 May 1964) is the head of the Section for the History of the Slovenian Language and a researcher at this Section. She is a co-author and one of the chief editors of the forthcoming Dictionary of the 16th-Century Slovenian Literary Language. She is interested in Slovenian terminology of different fields from 16th to 19th century, especially in Slovenian Christian terminology and the formation of terminology of other technical fields. She is chief editor of the monographic series Linguistica et philologica. She also works as assistant professor at the Postgraduate School ZRC SAZU. She writes scientific articles on lexicology and semantics, lexicography, terminology, Slovenian in contact with other languages and word formation. Through her scientific work and appearances in media she informs the general public of important Slovenian achievements in historical linguistics and culture. 2014–: assistant professor of linguistics (linguistic module), Postgraduate School ZRC SAZU 2009–2014: assistant professor of the Slovenian language, Department of Slovenian Studies, Faculty of Arts, University of Ljubljana stoletja (Liturgical Terminology in the Development of the Slovenian Literary Language (From Freising Manuscripts to the Establishment of a Unitary Literary Norm in the Mid-19th Century), Faculty of Arts, University of Ljubljana 1996: MA: Valentin Vodnik – oblikovalec slovenske terminologije: Upravno-politična in vojaška terminologija – Lublanske novice 1797 (Valentin Vodnik – Developer of Slovenian Terminology: Administrative-Political and Military Terminology – Lublanske Novice 1797), Faculty of Arts, University of Ljubljana 1988: BA degrees in A –­ Slovenian Language and Literature and B – Russian Language and Literature, Faculty of Arts, University of Ljubljana 2019–: member of the executive committee of the Slovenian Association for Research of the 18th Century 2017–: member of the editor council for New Etymological Dictionary of the Slovenian Language (NESSJ) authored by Metka Furlan 1998–: member of the Slovenian Committee of Slavists at International Committee of Slavists 1997–1999: member of the Managing Committee and treasurer of the Slavic Society of Slovenia 2019: organization and leadership of the Interdisciplinary Science Symposium »Revived Vodnik«: at the 200th anniversary of the death of Valentin Vodnik 2019: co-editor and co-author of the scientific monograph Oživljeni Vodnik: Razprave o Valentinu Vodniku (Vodnik Revived: Discussions on Valentin Vodnik) 2016: co-editor of the scientific monograph Lipalja vas in njena slovenska govorica (Lipalja Vas and its Slovenian Speech)
sl_doc: Vodja Sekcije za zgodovino slovenskega jezika, višja znanstvena sodelavka, docentka, raziskovalka pri pripravi Slovarja slovenskega knjižnega jezika 16. stoletja Andreja Legan Ravnikar (2. 5. 1964) je vodja Sekcije za zgodovino slovenskega jezika na Inštitutu za slovenski jezik Frana Ramovša in raziskovalka v tej enoti. Je soavtorica in ena od glavnih urednikov nastajajočega Slovarja slovenskega knjižnega jezika 16. stoletja. Raziskuje tudi slovensko strokovno izrazje različnih področij od 16. do 19. stoletja, posebej krščansko terminologijo in oblikovanje terminologije drugih strok. Je glavna urednica knjižne zbirke Linguistica et philologica. Dela tudi kot docentka na Podiplomski šoli ZRC SAZU. Piše večinoma znanstvene članke s področij besedoslovja in pomenoslovja, slovaropisja, terminologije, slovenščine v stiku in besedotvorja. Prek strokovnega pisanja in nastopanja v medijih širšo javnost seznanja s pomembnimi dosežki iz slovenske jezikovne in kulturne zgodovine. 2014–: docentka za jezikoslovje na Podiplomski šoli ZRC SAZU (Jezikoslovni modul) 2009–2014: docentka za slovenski jezik na Filozofski fakulteti Univerze v Ljubljani 2002: doktorat na temo Obredna terminologija v razvoju slovenskega knjižnega jezika (Od Brižinskih spomenikov do ustalitve enotne knjižne norme sredi 19. stoletja) na Filozofski fakulteti Univerze v Ljubljani 1996: znanstveni magisterij na temo Valentin Vodnik – oblikovalec slovenske terminologije (Upravno-politična in vojaška terminologija – Lublanske novice 1797) na Filozofski fakulteti Univerze v Ljubljani 1988: diploma na Filozofski fakulteti Univerze v Ljubljani (A –­ slovenski jezik in književnost, B – ­ruski jezik in književnost) 2019–: članica Izvršilnega odbora Slovenskega društva za preučevanje 18. stoletja 2017–: članica Uredniškega sveta spletnega Novega etimološkega slovarja slovenskega jezika Metke Furlan 1998–: članica Slovenskega slavističnega komiteja pri Mednarodnem slavističnem komiteju 1997–1999: članica upravnega odbora in blagajničarka Slavističnega društva Slovenije 2019: organizacija in vodenje interdisciplinarnega znanstvenega simpozija Oživljeni Vodnik: Ob 200-letnici smrti Valentina Vodnika (skupaj z Ireno Orel) 2019: urednica in soavtorica znanstvene monografije Oživljeni Vodnik: Razprave o Valentinu Vodniku (skupaj z Ireno Orel in Alenko Jelovšek) 2016: urednica znanstvene monografije Lipalja vas in njena slovenska en_doc: English Abstract: This article deals with the "Oceno situacije" and especially in the context of the Intelligence preparation of the battlefield (IPB) according to the U.S. Field manual (FM 34 - 130), which is in my opinion much more useful to the tactical level, as defined by the "Navodilo za štabno delo". Abstract: This article deals with the "Oceno situacije" and especially in the context of the Intelligence preparation of the battlefield (IPB) according to the U.S. Field manual (FM 34 - 130), which is in my opinion much more useful to the tactical level, as defined by the "Navodilo za štabno delo". This article deals with the "Oceno situacije" and especially in the context of the Intelligence preparation of the battlefield (IPB) according to the U.S. Field manual (FM 34 - 130), which is in my opinion much more useful to the tactical level, as defined by the "Navodilo za štabno delo". The purpose of article is to establish clear guidance for implementation OPB at the tactical level especially in the battalion and brigade headquarters.
sl_doc: Opis: Zaključna naloga obravnava Oceno situacije in v okviru nje predvsem Obveščevalno pripravo bojišča po ameriškem priročniku (FM 34 - 130), ki lahko na taktičnem nivoju, sam sem se osredotočil na bataljonsko raven, odlično dopolni in v določenih segmentih nadgradi Navodilo za štabno delo.

en_doc: Insertion in the array is O(1) if done at the back. Deletion in the array is O(1) if the element is removed from the back. In Insert Delete GetRandom problem we need to design a data structure that supports all following operations in average O(1) time. In Insert Delete GetRandom problem we need to design a data structure that supports all following operations in average O(1) time. insert(val): Inserts an item val to the set if not already present. insert(val): Inserts an item val to the set if not already present. remove(val): Removes an item val from the set if present. getRandom: Returns a random element from the current set of elements. Each element must have the same probability of being returned. As the question needs insertion and deletion operation in O(1), hence we need a map. But for getRandom() method, we need an index-based data structure like an array so that we can randomly choose any index element to return. Hence to get all the three functionalities, we can use both map and array together.
sl_doc: Vstavitev v matrika je O (1), če je narejeno zadaj. Če je element odstranjen s hrbtne strani, je v matriki izbrisano O (1). V težavi Insert Delete GetRandom moramo oblikovati podatkovno strukturo, ki podpira vse naslednje operacije v povprečno O (1) čas. insert (val): Vstavi element val v nabor, če še ni prisoten. remove (val): Odstrani element val iz niza, če je prisoten. getRandom: vrne naključni element iz trenutnega nabora elementov. Vsak element mora imeti enaka verjetnost vrnitve. Ker vprašanje potrebuje operacijo vstavljanja in brisanja v O (1), zato potrebujemo zemljevid. Toda za metodo getRandom () potrebujemo podatkovno strukturo, ki temelji na indeksu, kot je matrika, da lahko naključno izberemo kateri koli element indeksa, ki ga želimo vrniti. Za pridobitev vseh treh funkcionalnosti lahko skupaj uporabimo zemljevid in matriko. getRandom: vrne naključni element iz trenutnega nabora elementov. Vsak element mora imeti enaka verjetnost vrnitve. V težavi Insert Delete GetRandom moramo oblikovati podatkovno strukturo, ki podpira vse naslednje operacije v povprečno O (1) čas.

en_doc: Within law of social security of the European Union a new enactment on coordinating social security systems came to power on 1st May 2010. Within law of social security of the European Union a new enactment on coordinating social security systems came to power on 1st May 2010. Regarding the continuation and further use of the (new) coordination rules, which are highly associated with the free-travelling immunity, the current work introduces an analysis of the comparative and lawful overview of the old and new legal regulation. In general, the new enactment upgrades the European coordination principles and strengthens their function. As many coordination rules have experienced modernization, clearness, simplification, transparency and better structure, now they are much more understandable and accessible to rightful claimants/insured people (they have actually been designed for). In spite of achievements of the new and ‘modernised’ social security system coordination of the European Union, a lot of questions have remained. The ‘closed’ material validity (rights/contributions regarding the European coordination are listed appraisingly instead of comparatively); parallel validity of the old and new regulation; significance of new definitions and actual efficiency of rules in practice; preparative arrangements (transition) and final operation of the unified electronic system stay the main deficiency of the new enactment. Cooperation among national holders of social insurances and support by agencies of the European Union are extremely important during the transition period. According to the future development of the European social security system the work questions problematic issues, sets out the judiciary practice of the Court of Justice of the European Union, and discusses problems on modernising a unified European social security system. On behalf of restructured contents, the new enactment on social security system coordination still assuring and increasing the free-travelling immunity in the first place holds no greater changes. The crucial rules stay in power and the main intention of coordination is to connect social security systems without unifying (harmonizing) them. Simplification and modernisation are the main goals of the new enactment. Last but not least, some ‘technical’ changes (‘administrative’ progress) and new guidelines regarding decision processes on social rights are of great importance as they consecutively insure a higher level of rights protection. The material validity (complemented by the contributions on behalf of fatherhood and by rights on pre-retirement ‘only’) of social security system coordination stays in charge and enables no new ‘independent’ rights, although there have been put out some rights, contributions and services by the judgements of the Court of Justice of the European Union for several times already, which should be a matter of coordination (rights on behalf of long-term nursing, medical services and contributions to those, who are under threat from becoming unemployed). For the usage continuation of coordination rules (and further development of the European system/social security law as well) the ‘new’ and extended personal validity of the new coordination enactment including all citizens of the European Union, the economically active and inactive ones, is more than urgent. Due to the circumstances mentioned, the new regulation lays great stress upon provisions dealing with the European citizenship, social solidarity and basic principles on the social security system coordination (above all, the territorial principle and the principle of equal treatment).
sl_doc: Opis: V okviru prava socialne varnosti Evropske unije je s 01.05.2010 začela veljati nova uredbena ureditev koordinacije sistemov socialne varnosti. V magistrski nalogi je z vidika nadaljnje uporabe (novih) koordinacijskih pravil, ki so tesno povezana s svoboščino prostega gibanja ljudi, predstavljena analiza primerjalno-pravnega pregleda stare in nove ureditve. Načela evropske koordinacije so tudi v splošnem z novo uredbo nadgrajena in njihova vloga je okrepljena. Številna koordinacijska pravila so posodobljena, preglednejša, enostavnejša, transparentnejša in bolje strukturirana ter posledično za upravičence/zavarovance (katerim so ta pravila tudi dejansko namenjena) lažje razumljiva in dostopnejša. Kljub dosežkom nove »modernizirane« koordinacije sistemov socialne varnosti v Evropski uniji, odprta vprašanja ostajajo. Pomanjkljivost predstavlja »zaprta« stvarna veljavnost (pravice/dajatve, ki so predmet evropske koordinacije, so naštete taksativno in ne primeroma); vzporedna veljava stare in nove ureditve; vprašanje pomena novih definicij in dejanske učinkovitosti pravil v praksi; priprava (prehod) in končno delovanje enotnega elektronskega sistema. V prehodnem obdobju sta še posebej pomembni sodelovanje med nacionalnimi nosilci socialnih zavarovanj in pomoč s strani organov Evropske unije. Z vidika kontinuitete oziroma nadaljnjega razvoja evropskega sistema socialne varnosti pa so v nalogi izpostavljena predvsem odprta vprašanja, sodna praksa Sodišča Evropske unije in problematika modernizacije enotnega evropskega sistema socialne varnosti. Nova uredbena ureditev koordinacije sistemov socialne varnosti, katere glavno vodilo je še vedno zagotavljanje in vzpodbujanje svobode gibanja ljudi, z vsebinskega vidika večjih sprememb ne prinaša. Temeljna pravila se ohranjajo in namen koordinacije je še vedno povezovanje sistemov socialne varnosti, brez njihovega poenotenja (harmonizacije). Glavna cilja nove ureditve sta poenostavitev in modernizacija. Pomembne so tudi nekatere »tehnične« spremembe (»administrativni« napredek) in novosti glede postopkov odločanja o socialnih pravicah, kar posledično zagotavlja višjo stopnjo varstva pravic. Koordinacija sistemov socialne varnosti svojo materialno veljavnost (ki je »zgolj« dopolnjena z dajatvami iz naslova očetovstva in pred-upokojitvenimi pravicami) ohranja, ter novih »samostojnih« pravic ne prinaša, pa čeprav je Sodišče Evropske unije v svojih sodbah že večkrat opozorilo na nekatere pravice oziroma dajatve in storitve, ki bi prav tako morale biti predmet koordinacije (pravice iz naslova dolgotrajne oskrbe, zdravstvene storitve in dajatve za tiste, ki jim brezposelnost šele grozi). Za kontinuiteto uporabe koordinacijskih pravil (kot tudi za nadaljnji razvoj evropskega sistema/prava socialne varnosti) je pomembna »nova« širša osebna veljavnost nove koordinacijske uredbe, saj le-ta vključuje vse državljane Evropske unije, tako ekonomsko aktivne kot tudi neaktivne. V posledici navedenega so tako v novi ureditvi povzdignjene določbe evropskega državljanstva, socialna solidarnost in temeljna načela koordinacije sistemov socialne varnosti (predvsem teritorialno načelo in načelo enakega obravnavanja).
comments: lahko bi bil tudi Opinion/Argumentation

en_doc: From dried plums pits must be taken out and the meat expanded. This is followed by compression of meat of two plums together and finnaly edges should be rounded. The procedure it is more complex then peeling. It is called pogačanje - making flat cakes. 4th October, 2005. Laurel leaves (Laurus nobilis) take away moths. The family started to make prunele at the end of the 19th century and finished at the end of the fifties of the 20th century, around 1958. sl_doc: Posušene slive je potrebno razkoščičiti in suho meso razprostreti. Temu sledi stiskanje mesa dveh sliv v prunelo in zaobljanje robov. Postopek je zahtevnejši kot lupljenje. Imenuje se pogačanje. 4. oktober 2005. Lovorikini listi (Laurus nobilis) odganjajo molje. Pri Zahišarjevih so z izdelovanjem prunel pričeli ob koncu 19. stoletja, s to dejavnostjo pa so prenehali okoli leta 1958. Sliko so posneli v tistem času. Olupek oziroma lubulje po domače v enem kosu, 25. september 2005.

en_doc: Whether or not the Thunderbird Menu Bar is displayed depends on your Operating System. For Windows and Linux users, there are two cases: For existing Thunderbird users, if the Menu Bar is missing, it is usually because it has been hidden accidentally. For new Thunderbird users starting in any version of Thunderbird released in November 2012 or later, the Menu Bar is hidden by default. For Mac users, it is not possible to hide the Menu Bar, so Mac users always see the Menu Bar. If you're using any version of Thunderbird released in November 2012 or later, you now have a menu button on the top-right corner that takes the most common functions and puts them in one menu. For new Thunderbird users, the Menu Bar is hidden by default. To temporarily show the Menu Bar, just press the Alt key. To temporarily show the Menu Bar, hit the F10 key. To have the Menu Bar shown all the time, right-click on an empty section of the Tab Strip and check Menu Bar in the pop-up menu. Related Articles
sl_doc: Od vašega operacijskega sistema je odvisno, ali je Thunderbirdova vrstica z menijem prikazana ali ne. Pri uporabnikih sistema Linux ali Windows obstajata dve možnosti: Če pri obstoječih uporabnikih Thunderbirda vrstice z menijem ni, je to verjetno zato, ker je bila ponesreči skrita. Za uporabnike, ki so Thunderbird začeli uporabljati novembra 2012 ali kasneje, je vrstica z menijem privzeto skrita. Uporabniki sistema Mac ne morejo skriti vrstice z menijem, zato jo uporabniki sistema Mac vedno vidijo. Če uporabljate katerokoli različico Thunderbirda, izdano novembra 2012 ali kasneje, imate zgoraj desno gumb menija, ki vsebuje najpogosteje uporabljane funkcije in jih združi v enem meniju, in za nove uporabnike Thunderbirda je vrstica z menijem privzeto skrita. Da začasno prikažete vrstico z menijem, samo pritisnite tipko Alt. Da začasno prikažete vrstico z menijem, samo pritisnite tipko F10. Da trajno prikažete vrstico z menijem, z desno miškino tipko kliknite na prazen del vrstice z zavihki in v pojavnem meniju potrdite Vrstica z menijem. Da trajno prikažete vrstico z menijem, z desno miškino tipko kliknite na prazen del vrstice z zavihki in v pojavnem meniju potrdite Vrstica z menijem.

en_doc: Digital Agenda for Europe Over the past three decades, technological ‘convergence’ has been blurring the boundaries between telecommunications, broadcasting and IT. The Commission launched the digital single market in 2015 to deliver the main legislative proposals, such as boosting e-commerce, copyright, ePrivacy, harmonisation of digital rights, harmonised VAT rules and cybersecurity. These are all key elements for a Digital Europe. Objectives Following up on the Lisbon Strategy, the Digital Agenda for Europe[2] was conceived as one of the seven flagship initiatives of the Europe 2020 strategy adopted by the Commission. Following up on the Lisbon Strategy, the Digital Agenda for Europe[2] was conceived as one of the seven flagship initiatives of the Europe 2020 strategy adopted by the Commission. Published in May 2010, it sets out to define the key enabling role that the use of ICTs will have to play if Europe wants to succeed in its ambitious 2020 goals. In order to ensure a fair, open and secure digital environment, the Commission consequently built the Digital Single Market Strategy on three pillars: providing better access for consumers and businesses to digital goods and services across Europe, creating the right conditions for digital networks and services to flourish, and maximising the growth potential of the digital economy. In order to ensure a fair, open and secure digital environment, the Commission consequently built the Digital Single Market Strategy on three pillars: providing better access for consumers and businesses to digital goods and services across Europe, creating the right conditions for digital networks and services to flourish, and maximising the growth potential of the digital economy. Achievements Achievements Since the opening up of the telecommunications market to full competition on 1 January 1998 and the beginning of its implementation, the Digital Single Market Strategy has delivered the main legislative proposals set out in it as priorities. First, to provide better access for consumers and businesses to digital goods and services across Europe, and to provide the EU with an advanced system of user rights and protection for consumers and businesses, including: Second, in order to create the right conditions for digital networks and services to flourish at the EU level, the Body of European Regulators for Electronic Communications (BEREC) (established by Regulation (EU) 2018/1971) provides for cooperation between national regulators and the Commission, promoting best practices and common approaches, while at the same time avoiding inconsistent regulation that could risk distorting competition in the single market in telecommunications. As regards spectrum management, the multiannual radio spectrum policy programme sets out policy directions and objectives for the strategic planning and harmonisation of the radio spectrum. This ensures that the internal market functions in Union policy areas involving spectrum use, such as electronic communications, research, technological development and space, transport, energy and audiovisual policies. Third, the Digital Agenda for Europe aims at maximising the growth potential of the digital economy, by promoting digital skills and high-performance computing, digitising industry and services, developing artificial intelligence and modernising public services. New rules on the portability of digital services were adopted to allow consumers who have paid for online content services in their home country to access them when visiting another country within the EU and started to be applied from 1 April 2018. A Europe fit for the digital age is now a key priority of the EU. In its recent series of communications on artificial intelligence (COM(2020)0065) and data strategy (COM(2020)0066), the Commission highlighted the creation of a single market for data, in particular industrial and commercial data, as a key driver of the digital economy. In June 2020, the Commission announced in its communication ‘Europe’s moment: Repair and Prepare for the Next Generation’ (COM(2020)0456) that the digital single market will be a pillar in the COVID-19 recovery. Proposals include developing e-ID, investing in AI, cybersecurity, 5G networks, quantum and blockchain, building a real data economy and developing national e-procurement systems. Parliament advocates a robust and advanced ICT policy and has been very active in the adoption of legislative acts in the area. It has also continuously helped to keep the focus on ICT issues, through own-initiative reports, oral and written questions, studies, workshops, opinions and resolutions, as well as through calls for greater coordination of national efforts for the development of pan-European services and EU support for ICT research and development[6]. Parliament has underlined the need to use the ‘digital dividend’ spectrum to achieve broadband for all EU citizens, and has stressed that further action is needed to ensure ubiquitous, high-speed access to broadband, as well as digital literacy and competences for all citizens and consumers. At the same time, Parliament strongly promotes technological neutrality, ‘net neutrality’ and ‘net freedoms’ for European citizens, as well as measures regarding access to or use of services and applications through telecommunications networks, on the basis of respect for the fundamental rights and freedoms of citizens. Such measures must also ensure that internet service providers do not degrade users’ ability to access content and applications and/or run services of their own choice, as described in Parliament’s resolution of 17 November 2011 on the open internet and net neutrality in Europe. It is at the forefront in removing obstacles within the digital single market and modernising EU telecoms rules for today’s digital and data products and services in order to maximise the digitalisation of the European services sectors, which leads to new jobs and opportunities. It aims at boosting cross-border commerce, harmonising digital contract rules, guaranteeing affordable cross-border parcel delivery services, supporting the free flow of non-personal data and implementing simpler VAT declaration procedures. Parliament has initiated and completed important legislative work on measures to reduce the cost of deploying high-speed electronic communications networks (Directive 2014/61/EU) and on electronic identification and trust services for electronic transactions in the internal market (Regulation (EU) No 910/2014) in order to facilitate electronic businesses. Furthermore, Parliament successfully finalised the legislative work improving data protection by reforming the data protection framework and cybersecurity rules, approving the creation of a European ICT security framework, organising ICT certification in the EU, promoting investments in essential cybersecurity industrial capacities, guaranteeing an effective application of the protection of natural persons in relation to the processing of personal data as a fundamental right (Directive (EU) 2016/680), and protecting natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data (Regulation (EU) 2016/679). This latter regulation aims to correct the following: fragmentation in the implementation of data protection across the Union, legal uncertainty and a widespread public perception that there are significant risks to the protection of natural persons (in particular with regard to online activity). Recently, Parliament’s Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs (LIBE) voted in favour of rules on respect for private life and the protection of personal data in electronic communications with a view to helping businesses (COM(2017)0010). Parliament is closely monitoring the implementation by the Commission of the Digital Single Market (DSM) strategy roadmap and has in that context adopted a resolution entitled ‘Towards a Digital Single Market Act’. At the request of the Committee on the Internal Market and Consumer Protection (IMCO), Parliament’s Policy Department for Economic, Scientific and Quality of Life Policies organised a workshop entitled ‘E-commerce rules, fit for the digital age’, following which various research papers concerning platform liability, stronger enforcement measures and the use of AI were published[7]. These research papers contributed to Parliament’s resolutions of 20 October 2020 on the Digital Services Act, more specifically on improving the functioning of the single market, adapting commercial and civil law rules for commercial entities operating online, and the fundamental rights issues posed. Furthermore, a study requested by the IMCO Committee entitled ‘Legal obstacles in Member States to Single Market rules’[8] found that a lack of reliable information on relevant laws and regulations in Member States causes problems for nearly all aspects of e-commerce. However, the Digital Single Gateway (Regulation (EU) 2018/1724) may help to remedy this. Parliament has established the Special Committee on Artificial Intelligence in a Digital Age (AIDA) to examine the future impact of artificial intelligence on the EU economy. Parliament has established the Special Committee on Artificial Intelligence in a Digital Age (AIDA) to examine the future impact of artificial intelligence on the EU economy. In its resolution of 17 April 2020 on EU coordinated action to combat the COVID-19 pandemic and its consequences, Parliament called on the Commission to further develop its capacity for cloud services to facilitate the exchange of research and health data at EU level and the development of a vaccine while complying with the ePrivacy Directive and the GDPR. On 15 December 2020, the Commission submitted its proposed Digital Services Act package to Parliament and the Council under the codecision procedure. Upcoming research on the impact of targeted advertising on advertisers, market access and consumer choice aims to understand the new dynamics of the online advertising market. With reference to the internal market and digital services specifically, it will examine how targeted advertisements relate to the free movement of services, the extent to which existing legislation is sufficient in addressing concerns, and which future legislative or policy developments are necessary. [3]Joint statement issued by the Maltese Presidency of the Council of the European Union, the European Parliament and the European Commission on 14 June 2017. sl_doc: Ti so zagotavljanje boljšega dostopa potrošnikov in podjetij do digitalnega blaga in storitev po vsej Evropi, ustvarjanje ustreznih pogojev za razcvet digitalnih omrežij in storitev ter povečanje potenciala rasti digitalnega gospodarstva. Nadalje je bilo v študiji, ki jo je naročil Odbor za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov z naslovom Legal obstacles in Member States to Single Market rules (Pravne ovire v državah članicah za pravila enotnega trga)[8] ugotovljeno, da pomanjkanje zanesljivih informacij o ustreznih zakonih in predpisih v državah članicah povzroča težave za skoraj vse vidike e-trgovanja. Parlament je začel in dokončal pomembno zakonodajno delo v zvezi z ukrepi za znižanje stroškov za postavitev elektronskih komunikacijskih omrežij visokih hitrosti (Direktiva 2014/61/EU) ter o elektronski identifikaciji in storitvah zaupanja za elektronske transakcije na notranjem trgu (Uredba (EU) št. 910/2014), katerih namen je omogočanje elektronskega poslovanja. Od 1. januarja 1998, ko so se trgi telekomunikacij odprli za konkurenco in se je začela izvajati strategija za enotni digitalni trg, je slednja privedla do osrednjih zakonodajnih predlogov, ki so bili opredeljeni kot prednostni. Junija 2020 je Komisija v svojem sporočilu z naslovom Čas za Evropo: obnova in priprava za naslednjo generacijo (COM(2020)0456) napovedala, da bo enotni digitalni trg eden od stebrov pri okrevanju po covidu-19. Študije so prispevale k resolucijam Parlamenta z dne 20. oktobra 2020 o aktu o digitalnih storitvah, zlasti k izboljšanju delovanja enotnega trga, prilagoditvi pravil poslovnega in civilnega prava za poslovne subjekte, ki poslujejo na spletu in k vprašanjem, ki se zastavljajo na področju temeljnih pravic. Nadalje je bilo v študiji, ki jo je naročil Odbor za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov z naslovom Legal obstacles in Member States to Single Market rules (Pravne ovire v državah članicah za pravila enotnega trga)[8] ugotovljeno, da pomanjkanje zanesljivih informacij o ustreznih zakonih in predpisih v državah članicah povzroča težave za skoraj vse vidike e-trgovanja. Parlament je ustanovil Posebni odbor za umetno inteligenco v digitalni dobi (AIDA), ki bo ocenil prihodnji vpliv umetne inteligence na gospodarstvo EU. Ta sveženj vsebuje dve zakonodajni pobudi, akt o digitalnih storitvah in akt o digitalnih trgih. Glavni cilji svežnja je ustvariti varnejši digitalni prostor, v katerem so zaščitene temeljne pravice uporabnikov digitalnih storitev, ter zagotoviti enake konkurenčne pogoje za spodbujanje inovacij, rasti in konkurenčnosti na evropskem enotnem trgu in po svetu. F. in drugi, Ubiquitous Developments of the Digital Single Market (Vsesplošen razvoj enotnega digitalnega trga), publikacija za Odbor za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov, tematski sektor za gospodarsko in znanstveno politiko ter kakovost življenja, Evropski parlament, Luksemburg, 2013. [8]Dahlberg, E. in drugi, Legal obstacles in Member States to Single Market rules (Pravne ovire v državah članicah za pravila enotnega trga), publikacija, ki jo je za Odbor za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov pripravil tematski sektor za gospodarsko in znanstveno politiko ter kakovost življenja, Evropski parlament, Luksemburg, 2020. Evropska digitalna agenda V zadnjih treh desetletjih je tehnološko zbliževanje zabrisalo meje med telekomunikacijami, radiodifuzijo in informacijsko tehnologijo. Komisija je leta 2015 začela uvajati enotni digitalni trg, da bi pripravila poglavitne zakonodajne predloge, na primer o spodbujanju e-poslovanja, avtorskih pravicah, zasebnosti v elektronskih komunikacijah, harmonizaciji digitalnih pravic, harmonizaciji pravil o DDV in kibernetski varnosti. Evropska digitalna agenda[2] je bila na podlagi lizbonske strategije zasnovana kot ena od sedmih vodilnih pobud strategije Evropa 2020, ki jo je sprejela Komisija. Objavljena je bila maja 2010 in v njej je opredeljeno, da mora imeti informacijsko-komunikacijska tehnologija osrednjo omogočitveno vlogo, če želi Evropa uresničiti svoje ambicije za leto 2020. Dosežki Od 1. januarja 1998, ko so se trgi telekomunikacij odprli za konkurenco in se je začela izvajati strategija za enotni digitalni trg, je slednja privedla do osrednjih zakonodajnih predlogov, ki so bili opredeljeni kot prednostni. S temi predlogi naj bi potrošnikom in podjetjem zagotovili boljši dostop do digitalnega blaga in storitev po vsej Evropi, EU opremili z naprednim sistemom uporabniških pravic ter poskrbeli za varstvo potrošnikov in podjetij, kar med drugim pomeni: Da bi na ravni EU zagotovili ustrezne pogoje za razvoj digitalnih omrežij in storitev, Organ evropskih regulatorjev za elektronske komunikacije (BEREC) (ustanovljen z Uredbo (EU) 2018/1971) skrbi za sodelovanje med nacionalnimi regulatorji in Komisijo, pri čemer spodbuja dobre prakse in skupne pristope, hkrati pa preprečuje neusklajeno regulacijo, zaradi katere bi lahko prišlo do izkrivljanja konkurence na enotnem telekomunikacijskem trgu. Kar zadeva upravljanje spektra, večletni program politike radijskega spektra določa usmeritve in cilje za strateško načrtovanje in usklajevanje radijskega spektra. To zagotavlja delovanje notranjega trga v vseh politikah Unije, ki vključujejo uporabo spektra, kot so politika elektronskih komunikacij, politika raziskav, tehnološkega razvoja in vesolja, politika prometa, politika energije in avdiovizualna politika. Namen evropske digitalne agende je čim bolj povečati potencial digitalnega gospodarstva za rast, in sicer s spodbujanjem digitalnih veščin in visoko zmogljivega računalništva, digitalizacijo gospodarskih panog in storitev, razvojem umetne inteligence in posodobitvijo javnih storitev. Sprejeta so bila nova pravila o prenosljivosti digitalnih storitev, da bi potrošniki, ki storitve spletnih vsebin plačajo v svoji matični državi, lahko do njih dostopali tudi med obiskom drugih držav EU. Uporabljajo se od 1. aprila 2018. Evropa, pripravljena na digitalno dobo, je zdaj ključna prednostna naloga EU. Komisija je v nedavnem nizu sporočil o umetni inteligenci (COM(2020)0065) in podatkovni strategiji (COM(2020)0066) izpostavila oblikovanje enotnega trga za podatke, zlasti industrijskih in komercialnih podatkov, ki so ključno gonilo digitalnega gospodarstva. Junija 2020 je Komisija v svojem sporočilu z naslovom Čas za Evropo: obnova in priprava za naslednjo generacijo (COM(2020)0456) napovedala, da bo enotni digitalni trg eden od stebrov pri okrevanju po covidu-19. Predlogi vključujejo razvoj elektronske identifikacije, naložbe v umetno inteligenco, kibernetsko varnost, omrežja 5G, kvantne in blokovne verige, izgradnjo realnega podatkovnega gospodarstva in razvoj nacionalnih sistemov e-javnih naročil. Parlament se zavzema za stabilno in napredno politiko na področju informacijsko-komunikacijske tehnologije in je zelo dejaven pri sprejemanju zakonodajnih aktov na tem področju. Poleg tega ves čas opozarja na problematiko tega področja s samoiniciativnimi poročili, pisnimi in ustnimi vprašanji, študijami, predstavitvami, mnenji in resolucijami ter s pozivi k bolj usklajenim nacionalnim prizadevanjem za razvoj vseevropskih storitev in k podpori EU za področje raziskav in razvoja informacijsko-komunikacijske tehnologije[6]. Parlament je poudaril, da je treba spekter digitalne dividende uporabiti za to, da bi vzpostavili širokopasovni dostop za vse državljane EU, ter da so potrebni nadaljnji ukrepi za zagotovitev vsesplošnega, visokohitrostnega širokopasovnega dostopa ter digitalne pismenosti in kompetenc vseh državljanov in potrošnikov. Poleg tega se odločno zavzema za tehnološko nevtralnost, omrežno nevtralnost in internetne svoboščine evropskih državljanov, pa tudi za ukrepe dostopa do storitev in aplikacij ter njihove uporabe prek telekomunikacijskih omrežij, pri čemer je treba spoštovati temeljne pravice in svoboščine državljanov. Takšni ukrepi morajo tudi zagotoviti, da ponudniki internetnih storitev ne bodo zmanjšali zmožnosti uporabnikov, da dostopajo do vsebin in aplikacij in/ali uporabljajo storitve po lastni izbiri, kot je opisano v resoluciji Parlamenta z dne 17. novembra 2011 o odprtem internetu in nevtralnosti omrežja v Evropi. Ima vodilno vlogo pri odpravljanju ovir na enotnem digitalnem trgu in pri posodabljanju telekomunikacijskih pravil EU, da bodo prilagojena sodobnim digitalno in podatkovno vodenim proizvodom in storitvam, da bi povečali digitalizacijo v evropskih storitvenih sektorjih, s tem pa pripomogli k zaposlovanju in novim priložnostim. Prav tako želi Parlament okrepiti čezmejno poslovanje, harmonizirati pravila o digitalnih pogodbah in zagotoviti cenovno dostopne storitve čezmejne dostave paketov ter podpira prosti pretok neosebnih podatkov in izvajanje preprostejših postopkov za prijavo DDV. Parlament je začel in dokončal pomembno zakonodajno delo v zvezi z ukrepi za znižanje stroškov za postavitev elektronskih komunikacijskih omrežij visokih hitrosti (Direktiva 2014/61/EU) ter o elektronski identifikaciji in storitvah zaupanja za elektronske transakcije na notranjem trgu (Uredba (EU) št. 910/2014), katerih namen je omogočanje elektronskega poslovanja. Poleg tega je uspešno zaključil zakonodajno delo za izboljšanje varstva podatkov z reformo okvira o varstvu podatkov in pravil o kibernetski varnosti, z oblikovanjem evropskega okvira za varnost IKT, organiziranjem certificiranja na področju informacijske in komunikacijske tehnologije v EU, spodbujanjem naložb v bistvene industrijske zmogljivosti za kibernetsko varnost, z zagotovitvijo učinkovitega izvajanje varstva posameznikov v zvezi z obdelavo osebnih podatkov kot njihove temeljne pravice (Direktiva (EU) 2016/680) ter z varstvom posameznikov pri obdelavi osebnih podatkov in o prostem pretoku takih podatkov (Uredba (EU) 2016/679). Predvsem s slednjim naj bi odpravili razdrobljenost pri izvajanju varstva podatkov v Uniji, pravno negotovost in razširjeno javno mnenje o velikih tveganjih za varstvo posameznikov, zlasti pri spletnih dejavnostih. Nedavno je Odbor Evropskega parlamenta za državljanske svoboščine, pravosodje in notranje zadeve (LIBE) glasoval za pravila o spoštovanju zasebnega življenja in o varstvu osebnih podatkov na področju elektronskih komunikacij, s katerimi bi pomagali podjetjem (COM(2017)0010). Parlament pozorno spremlja, kako Komisija izvaja načrt za strategijo za enotni digitalni trg, in je v zvezi s tem sprejel resolucijo z naslovom Aktu za enotni digitalni trg naproti. Tematski sektor Parlamenta za gospodarsko in znanstveno politiko ter kakovost življenja je na zahtevo Odbora za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov organiziral predstavitev o pravilih za elektronsko poslovanje, primernih za digitalno dobo, na podlagi katere so bile objavljene različne študije o odgovornosti platform, strožjih izvršilnih ukrepih in uporabi umetne inteligence[7]. Študije so prispevale k resolucijam Parlamenta z dne 20. oktobra 2020 o aktu o digitalnih storitvah, zlasti k izboljšanju delovanja enotnega trga, prilagoditvi pravil poslovnega in civilnega prava za poslovne subjekte, ki poslujejo na spletu in k vprašanjem, ki se zastavljajo na področju temeljnih pravic. Nadalje je bilo v študiji, ki jo je naročil Odbor za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov z naslovom Legal obstacles in Member States to Single Market rules (Pravne ovire v državah članicah za pravila enotnega trga)[8] ugotovljeno, da pomanjkanje zanesljivih informacij o ustreznih zakonih in predpisih v državah članicah povzroča težave za skoraj vse vidike e-trgovanja. Enotni digitalni portal (Uredba (EU) 2018/1724) bi lahko pomagal odpraviti te težave. Parlament je ustanovil Posebni odbor za umetno inteligenco v digitalni dobi (AIDA), ki bo ocenil prihodnji vpliv umetne inteligence na gospodarstvo EU. V svoji resoluciji z dne 17. aprila 2020 o usklajenem ukrepanju EU za spoprijemanje s pandemijo COVID-19 in njenimi posledicami je Parlament pozval Komisijo, naj še naprej razvija svoje zmogljivosti za storitve v oblaku, da bi olajšala izmenjavo raziskovalnih in zdravstvenih podatkov na ravni EU ter razvoj cepiva ob upoštevanju direktive o zasebnosti in elektronskih komunikacijah ter splošne uredbe o varstvu podatkov. Prihodnje raziskave o učinku ciljno usmerjenega oglaševanja na oglaševalce, dostop do trga in izbiro potrošnikov naj bi preučile novo dinamiko spletnega oglaševalskega trga. S posebnim poudarkom na notranjem trgu in digitalnimi storitvami bodo preučile, kako je ciljno usmerjeno oglaševanje povezano s prostim pretokom storitev, v kolikšni meri je veljavna zakonodaja ustrezna za obravnavanje pomislekov ter kateri zakonodajni ukrepi ali ukrepi politik so potrebni. [3]Skupna izjava malteškega predsedstva Sveta Evropske unije, Evropskega parlamenta in Evropske komisije z dne 14. junija 2017. [4]Dodatne informacije so na voljo na spletni strani Komisije „Reševanje potrošniških sporov“. [5]Platformo je Komisija vzpostavila 22. aprila 2015 v sodelovanju z Observatorijem za svetovno internetno politiko (GIPO). [6]Ustrezne raziskave vključujejo van Veenstra, A. [7]Ustrezne raziskave vključujejo: Nordemann, J. B., The functioning of the Internal Market for Digital Services: Responsibilities and duties of care of providers of Digital Services (Delovanje notranjega trga za digitalne storitve: odgovornosti in dolžnosti oskrbe ponudnikov digitalnih storitev), publikacija, ki jo je za Odbor za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov pripravil tematski sektor za gospodarsko in znanstveno politiko ter kakovost življenja, Evropski parlament, Luksemburg, 2020. Smith, M., Enforcement and cooperation between Member States – E-Commerce and the future Digital Services Act (Izvrševanje in sodelovanje med državami članicami – Elektronsko trgovanje in prihodnji akt o digitalnih storitvah), publikacija, ki jo je za Odbor za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov pripravil tematski sektor za gospodarsko in znanstveno politiko ter kakovost življenja, Evropski parlament, Luksemburg, 2020. Nove gospodarske priložnosti in izzivi za digitalne storitve 20 let po sprejetju Direktive o elektronskem poslovanju), publikacija, ki jo je za Odbor za notranji trg in varstvo potrošnikov pripravil tematski sektor za gospodarsko in znanstveno politiko ter kakovost življenja, Evropski parlament, Luksemburg, 2020. en_doc: You find that, instead of having the aroma of Italian coffee flair, your coffee machine smells somewhat bad? Then it’s high time for a thorough cleaning. At Bosch Home Appliances Service, we offer a range of special cleaners. Using them, your coffee machine will be cleaned quickly, easily, hygienically and safely. Bad smells quickly become a thing of the past. We offer a specially tested descaler which ensures a long-lasting cleaning of your machine. If your coffee maker is a fully automatic coffee machine, we recommend that you to contact our customer service deparmnet for service/repairs.
sl_doc: Ugotavljate, da namesto čudovite arome italijanske kave vaš kavni aparat oddaja nekoliko neprijetne vonjave? V tem primeru je napočil čas za temeljito čiščenje. V servisu hišnih aparatov Bosch ponujamo vrsto posebnih čistilnih sredstev. Z njihovo uporabo bo vaš kavni aparat očiščen hitro, enostavno, higiensko in varno. Neprijetne vonjave hitro postanejo preteklost. Ponujamo posebej preizkušeno sredstvo za odstranjevanje vodnega kamna, ki poskrbi za dolgotrajno čiščenje vašega aparata. Če je vaš aparat popolnoma avtomatski kavni aparat, priporočamo, da ga na popravilo prinesete v naš glavni servis. Kaj naj storim? Ugotavljate, da namesto čudovite arome italijanske kave vaš kavni aparat oddaja nekoliko neprijetne vonjave? V servisu hišnih aparatov Bosch ponujamo vrsto posebnih čistilnih sredstev. Z njihovo uporabo bo vaš kavni aparat očiščen hitro, enostavno, higiensko in varno. Neprijetne vonjave hitro postanejo preteklost. Ponujamo posebej preizkušeno sredstvo za odstranjevanje vodnega kamna, ki poskrbi za dolgotrajno čiščenje vašega aparata.

en_doc: Vehicles for particular subjects are vehicles, used for needs of the following: Leading politicians from foreign countries, their deputies/delegates on a special mission and needs of their retinue's members - for official and personal use. Diplomatic and consular missions from foreign countries in the Republic of Slovenia - for official use. Personnel of the diplomatic and consular missions from foreign countries in the Republic of Slovenia and their close family members - for personal use. Persons that acquired ownership of a vehicle on the basis of an inheritance decision. Plating certificate from the vehicle inspectorate or registration certificate or COC document. Plating certificate from the vehicle inspectorate or registration certificate or COC document.
sl_doc: Vozila za določene subjekte so vozila, ki so pridobljena za potrebe: šefov tujih držav in odposlancev šefov tujih držav v posebni misiji ter za potrebe članov njihovega spremstva - za službeno in osebno uporabo; diplomatskih in konzularnih predstavništev tujih držav v Republiki Sloveniji - za službeno uporabo; diplomatskega in konzularnega osebja tujih predstavništev v Republiki Sloveniji in njihovih ožjih družinskih članov - za osebno uporabo; oseb, ki so postali lastniki vozila na podlagi sklepa o dedovanju; Izvirnik prometnega dovoljenja ali izvirnik registracijskega dokumenta ali izvirnik potrdila o skladnosti od proizvajalca vozila oziroma njegovega pooblaščenega zastopnika (COC-dokument);

en_doc: Povzetek: The paper presents the impact of the clamping ratio of a clamped beech (Fagus sylvatica) cantilever specimen on the calculation of a dynamic modulus of elasticity. Povzetek: The paper presents the impact of the clamping ratio of a clamped beech (Fagus sylvatica) cantilever specimen on the calculation of a dynamic modulus of elasticity. First we measured the specimen's frequency of the first mode of damped transverse free vibrations of a specimen with free ends. The specimen was then clamped as a cantilever beam several times, from a clamping ratio of 18 to 105, and each time the frequency of the first damped transverse free vibrations was measured. In the case of small clamping ratios, the error was around 20 %, whereas in the case of large clamping ratios the error decreased to 5 %. The cause of the major error is insufficient specimen clamping rigidity, which is due - despite a sufficient rigidity of the clamping system - to the specimen compressibility in the transverse radial or tangential directions where the modulus of elasticity is more than ten times smaller than the modulus along the tissue.
sl_doc: Povzetek: Članek prikazuje vpliv vpenjalnega razmerja konzolno vpetega bukovega preizkušanca (Fagus sylvatica) na izračun dinamičnega modula elastičnosti. Povzetek: V članku je prikazana analiza aerodinamičnega vzbujanja prosto vrtečega se krožnega žagnega lista.

en_doc: Can you imagine anything better than experiencing a city through its delicious smells and flavours? According to an old Slovenian proverb, even love goes through the stomach. The best Celje-based chefs have found inspiration in the traditions, recipes and typical ingredients already known at the court of the Counts of Celje. They added personal creativity to make them contemporary. So, we recommend you to order one of the dishes already valued by the Counts of Celje. Taste the Count’s dishes in the City of the Counts. Let the table buckle under the weight of juicy meats, fresh vegetables and excellent wine.
sl_doc: Razišči Celje Kaj je lepšega kot doživeti mesto skozi vonje in okuse? Še ljubezen gre po starem slovenskem pregovoru skozi želodec. Najboljši celjski kuharski mojstri so poiskali navdih v tradiciji, recepturah in tipičnih sestavinah, ki so bile znane že na dvoru Celjskih grofov. Dodali so jim osebno ustvarjalnost in jih sodobno začinili. Priporočamo, da naročite eno od celjskih grofovskih jedi. Okusite grofovske jedi v mestu grofov. Naj se miza trese od sočnega mesa, sveže zelenjave in dobre kapljice. Okusite grofovske jedi v mestu grofov.

en_doc: Company registrationFor company registration in Montenegro you need your ID card and 1 € founding capital only. AdvantagesProfit tax is among the lowest in Europe, that means it is only 9%. Registration processThe registration process takes from 7 to 10 days. Do you know how many individuals and companies want to enter the Montenegro market every day and open their business in Montenegro? If you have decided to start a business in Montenegro, you made the right decision! To start a business in Montenegro you need only passport and 1 Euro. Advantages of doing business in Montenegro Profit tax is among the lowest in Europe, that means it is only 9%. If business owner wants to cash out profit and transfer it on his personal bank account pays only 9% tax. Also in this case the tax in Slovenia is much higher, it is 25%. Also value-added tax- VAT is lower in Montenegro than in Slovenia, it is 19%. Montenegro as the only non-European Union member has Euro € as national currency, so you can withdraw your money from ATM (automated teller machine). Starting capital is only 1 EURO. Step by step to company We will check the register if name is free and book it for you. We will need some information about you: Activity of the company Once we have all the information necessary, we will prepare documentation for starting a business in Montenegro. Once we have all the information necessary, we will prepare documentation for starting a business in Montenegro. Director and business owner have to come in Montenegro for the transcript of the company and they must have their identity documents with them. At notary you will have to sign and authenticate all documents needed (contract for establishing a company, authorizations, papers for the bank) The entire process is completed within 7 to 10 days. If you are interested in starting a business in Montenegro, please contact us on prodaja@agencijaspin.si or call us on telephone number +386 70 77 77 66 and we will help you. sl_doc: Odprtje podjetjaZa odprtje podjetja v Črni Gori je potreben samo osebni dokument in 1€ osnovnega kapitala. PrednostiDavek na dobiček znaša 9%, davek na dodano vrednost je 19%. PostopkiPostopek registracije podjetja traja od 7-10 dni. Če ste se odločili, da boste odprli podjetje v Črni Gori, ste se pravilno odločili! Za odprtje podjetja v Črni Gori je potreben samo osebni dokument in 1€. Nekaj prednosti poslovanja v Črni gori - Davek na dobiček je med najnižjimi v Evropi in znaša samo 9%, v Sloveniji znaša 17%. Če želi lastnik podjetja dvigniti dobiček in ga nakazati na svoj osebni račun plača 9% davka. Tudi v tem primeru je v Sloveniji davek višji in sicer 25%. Tudi davek na dodano vrednost- DDV, je v Črni Gori nižji kot v Sloveniji in sicer 19%. Črna Gora ima kot edina nečlanica Evropske Unije evro kot državno valuto, tako da lahko evre dvigujete tudi na bankomatu. Ustavitveni kapital znaša samo 1 EUR!! Korak po korak do podjetja Mi preverimo, če je ime podjetja na voljo in ga rezerviramo za vas. Od vas bomo potrebovali naslednje podatke: Ko bomo dobili vse potrebne informacije, vam bomo pripravili vso dokumentacijo za registracijo podjetja. Na podpis dokumentov v Črno Goro mora priti tako direktor kot tudi lastnik podjetja. S sabo morata imeti osebne dokumente. Mi za vas pripravimo vse dokumente, Vi samo pri notarju podpišete in overite vse potrebne dokumente (pogodba o ustanovitvi podjetja, pooblastila, dokumenti za banko,...) in nam jih vrnete nazaj po pošti. Če ste zainteresirani za ustanovitev podjetja v Črni Gori nam pišite na mail prodaja@agencijaspin.si ali nas pokličite na telefonsko številko 070 777 766 in pomagali vam bomo.

sl_doc: Pod eno najatraktivnejših slovenskih gora, Špikom, boste našli dva fantastična slapova. Še posebej spektakularen je Zgornji Martuljkov slap, ki v belem skalnatem objemu pada preko mogočne stene, pot povsem do njega pa popestri še kratek plezalni del. Pot je sicer večinoma lahka, vendar v bližini slapov teren postane strm, zato previdnost ni odveč. Pot je sicer večinoma lahka, vendar v bližini slapov teren postane strm, zato previdnost ni odveč.

en_doc: Completely renovated Venetian Gothic house from the 14th century in its beautiful ambience with a touch of Venetian combines cultural, wellness and overnight experience. Completely renovated Venetian Gothic house from the 14th century in its beautiful ambience with a touch of Venetian combines cultural, wellness and overnight experience. Casa Veneziana is located in the heart of the old town of Koper, close to the Port of Koper and 300 m from the town beach. We offer a new modern comfortable rooms with 4 star, equipped with everything the modern man needs for business, tourism or a nice rest. By prior arrangement you can enjoy our new SPA center in the private, romantic atmosphere. You can also rent bikes with us and go along the cycling route "Parenzana", as our location is ideal for starting point. If you are looking for the possibility of leisure, holiday or work time in a pleasant environment, you are cordially invited to spend some time with us. Personally, we will provide all the necessary information and will be happy to cater to your wishes. We will make sure you feel safe, relaxed and welcome and we are confident that you will love to come back.
sl_doc: Popolnoma obnovljena Beneško gotska hiša iz 14. stoletja v svojem čudovitem ambientu z beneškim pridihom združuje kulturno, sprostitveno in prenočitveno doživetje. Casa Veneziana se nahaja v starem mestnem jedru Kopra tik ob severni obvoznici in vhodu v Luko Koper, 300 m od mestne plaže. Nudimo vam nove sodobne komfortne sobe s 4-imi zvezdicami, opremljene z vsem, kar potrebuje sodoben človek za poslovni turizem ali prijeten oddih. Uživate lahko v novem SPA centru v zasebnem, romantičnem vzdušju s kaminom, infra red ogrevanjem, svežim sadjem in vrhunsko penino, ali pa si izposodite kolesa in se odpravite po “Parenzani”, saj je pri nas odlična izhodiščna točka za kolesarjenje. Če iščete možnost preživljanja prostega, dopustniškega ali delovnega časa v prijetnem okolju, vas vljudno vabimo, da nekaj svojega časa preživite z nami. Osebno vam bomo posredovali vse potrebne informacije in z veseljem ustregli vašim željam. Poskrbeli bomo, da se boste počutili varne, sproščene in dobrodošle in prepričani smo, da se boste z veseljem znova vračali.

sl_doc: „Skupek podatkov o kakovosti kopalnih voda“ pomeni podatke, pridobljene v skladu s členom 3. Sklep Evropskega parlamenta in Sveta št. 1600/2002/ES z dne 22. julija 2002 o šestem okoljskem akcijskem programu Skupnosti (5) vsebuje obvezo zagotovitve visoke ravni zaščite kopalnih voda, vključno z revizijo Direktive Sveta 76/160/EGS z dne 8. decembra 1975 o kakovosti kopalnih voda (6). Ker ciljev te direktive, namreč da bi države članice na podlagi skupnih standardov dosegle dobro kakovost kopalnih voda in visoko raven zaščite po vsej Skupnosti, ni možno zadovoljivo doseči na ravni držav članic in je te cilje možno bolje doseči na ravni Skupnosti, lahko Skupnost sprejme ukrepe v skladu z načelom subsidiarnosti iz člena 5 Pogodbe. „Razraščanje cianobakterij“ pomeni kopičenje cianobakterij v obliki cvetenja, prevleke ali pene. Pri sklicevanju na ta odstavek se uporabljata člena 5 in 7 Sklepa 1999/468/ES, ob upoštevanju določb člena 8 Sklepa. Države članice najkasneje do 24. marca 2008 sprejmejo zakone in druge predpise, potrebne za uskladitev s to direktivo. Zakonodajna resolucija Evropskega parlamenta z dne 18. januarja 2006 (še ni objavljeno v Uradnem listu) in Sklep Sveta z dne 20. decembra 2005.
